It is planned to work on both [[USB 2.0]] and [[USB 3.0]], and both on legacy [[BIOS]] and [[UEFI]] firmware.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html |title=Microsoft Demonstrates Windows To Go (Run Windows 8 From USB On Any PC) |publisher=Techie-buzz.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-16}}</ref>
It is planned to work on both [[USB 2.0]] and [[USB 3.0]], and both on legacy [[BIOS]] and [[UEFI]] firmware.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://techie-buzz.com/microsoft/windows-8-usb-to-go-demo.html |title=Microsoft Demonstrates Windows To Go (Run Windows 8 From USB On Any PC) |publisher=Techie-buzz.com |date= |accessdate=2011-09-16}}</ref>

For the first time Windows boots on a particular computer, it will install the required drivers for that particular hardware and reboot. Subsquent booting operations will boot straight into Windows 8.<ref>http://arstechnica.com/microsoft/news/2011/09/making-the-lives-of-it-easier-windows-8-refresh-reset-and-windows-to-go.ars</ref>
+
For the first time Windows boots on a particular computer, it will install the required drivers for that particular hardware and reboot. Subsequent booting operations will boot straight into Windows 8.<ref>http://arstechnica.com/microsoft/news/2011/09/making-the-lives-of-it-easier-windows-8-refresh-reset-and-windows-to-go.ars</ref>
